item.title: Comment on Paul Krugman retires as Times columnist by Hadur
item.description:
A complete partisan hack as a columnist, tragically so because he so obviously had the talent and intelligence to be something other than a partisan hack.

item.title: Comment on Paul Krugman retires as Times columnist by Robert
item.description:
Reply to Hadur:

A complete partisan hack as a columnist, tragically so because he so obviously had the talent and intelligence to be something other than a partisan hack.

Krugman--great intellect, zero integrity. (Perfect fit for the NYTimes)

item.title: Comment on Paul Krugman retires as Times columnist by (Not That) Bill O'Reilly
item.description:
Reply to Robert:

Krugman--great intellect, zero integrity. (Perfect fit for the NYTimes)

Really, a fitting avatar for the trend of spending down long-term institutional credibility for short-term partisan ends over the past ~25 years.

item.dc:creator: (Not That) Bill O'Reilly

item.title: Comment on Paul Krugman retires as Times columnist by Hadur
item.description:
Reply to Trinity:

If you can find a way to completely divorce personal political leanings from economic positions, I'll give you a cookie. Tyler and Alex don't even try to do this and nobody here is calling them partisan hacks. What does that criticism even mean in the comment section of an economics blog with heavy political overtones? That he doesn't share your politics?

Krugman the columnist was a hack because there was little long-term consistency in what he was saying - he made the argument of the day for whatever the blue team was trying to do at that moment in time. This is a bit different from, say, Alex just constantly reiterating the same libertarian talking points he has held since 1995.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/12/paul-krugman-retires-as-times-columnist.html?commentID=160843496

item.title: Comment on You Have Been Warned by Vulcidian
item.description:
I always enjoy these quick trip in Alex's universe, which is so different from my own. There are no borders or public schools, everyone uses cryptocurrency, and they all have bird flu.

item.title: Comment on My excellent Conversation with Stephen Kotkin by Kieran
item.description:
Great conversation. Thank you. One of the year’s best.

Wildly out of context quote below but it made me laugh out loud:

“If you survived the Stalin collectivization terror, and you wrote a memoir, you looked back on those days in the schoolyard, that Georgian revenge culture, and you said, “Oh, I remember when he was 11, and he put the cat in the microwave. I knew right then that we were all going to die.”

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/12/my-excellent-conversation-with-stephen-kotkin.html?commentID=160843246

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/12/my-excellent-conversation-with-stephen-kotkin.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=my-excellent-conversation-with-stephen-kotkin
